author: Rainer Sommer
title: Kick-off for Effective Digital Asset Management: CELUM Now Manages All Image Material for DFL Digital Sports
text:
As a 100 percent subsidiary of the DFL German Football League and headquartered in Cologne, Germany, DFL Digital Sports GmbH operates various media platforms. DFL Digital Sports develops and provides tailor-made digital solutions for the DFL. Jörg Banholzer, Director of Technology at DFL Digital Sports GmbH, explains: ‘Each match day, we source thousands of photos from various different resources, such as stock photo agencies or photographers. These images have to be published near-live in suitable quality for different platforms. Controlled publishing of video coverage of all games on match day, all with different rights, can be a real challenge. With CELUM, we now have a centralized solution for our Digital Asset Management System challenges.’
DFL’s external partners or license holders can access exclusive media content via a web portal. This content is managed in CELUM and automatically delivered to the portal. For editorial purposes, the solution supports comprehensive keyword management and targeted search possibilities for images and videos (e.g. all free-kick photos of Bayern Munich Star David Alba from the season 2013/2014).
Michael Kräftner, CELUM CEO, says of the new clients at DFL Digital Sports: ‘The German Soccer League is the best soccer league worldwide and is one of the largest sport leagues in the world. Through our partnership with DFL Digital Sports, we are happy to be part of an organization that inspires thousands of viewers each week with their images and transported emotions. Our clear goal is to support the complex daily business of DFL Digital Sports in the best way possible.’
Using CELUM software, DFL Digital Sports can now centrally control the publishing of images and video content across various channels (web, mobile, app) in several countries.
CELUM provides a ‘single source of truth’ solution for all media content at DFL Digital Sports, making them an integral part of the new digital framework at DFL, which also includes the FirstSpirit Content Management System from CELUM’s partner company e-Spirit.
